six_hat_analysis.white: Concrete requirements: Collect 110 real business listings (50 Event Planners, 30 Caterers, 30 Photographers) across 10 target cities with specific distribution per city. Must use Puppeteer for direct web browsing and manual extraction into CSV format. Have detailed data structure requirements defined in phase documentation including contact info, specializations, pricing, and business details. Must use legitimate sources like Yelp, industry directories, and professional associations.
six_hat_analysis.red: This feels like a substantial but rewarding data collection effort that will require patience and methodical attention to detail. The manual approach ensures authenticity and quality but will be time-intensive. There's genuine satisfaction in building a credible business directory with real, verified data rather than synthetic content. Some concern about maintaining focus and consistency across 110 listings.
six_hat_analysis.black: Main risks include: time-intensive manual process prone to data entry errors, potential anti-scraping measures on business directories, risk of outdated/inaccurate business information, challenge of maintaining data consistency across all listings, CSV format limitations for complex nested data, and difficulty verifying business operational status remotely.
six_hat_analysis.yellow: Manual extraction ensures high-quality verified data that will make EventPros.com genuinely useful and credible. Comprehensive coverage across 10 major cities provides excellent market representation. CSV format makes data easily importable into WordPress and manageable in Google Sheets. Direct browser automation provides authentic user perspective and access to full website content including reviews and detailed business information.
six_hat_analysis.green: Alternative approaches: organize data collection by city clusters for geographic efficiency, create standardized data entry templates to speed collection, use multiple browser tabs for cross-source verification, develop systematic source prioritization (start with highest-quality directories), implement progressive data validation as we collect, and consider batch processing by business type to develop expertise and speed.
six_hat_analysis.blue: Organize into 4 sequential tasks: (1) Research and validate data sources, (2) Event Planner collection with systematic city-by-city approach, (3) Caterer collection using established methodology, (4) Photographer collection and final CSV formatting. Implement quality checkpoints after each business type. Document methodology and sources for transparency and future updates.

data.denoised_plan:
**UNIFIED EXECUTION PLAN - EventPros Content Seeding Phase C**

**Core Strategy**: Execute systematic manual data collection using Puppeteer for authentic business directory browsing, prioritizing data quality and verification over speed. Organize collection by business type to develop expertise and maintain consistency.

**Execution Framework**:
1. **Source Research & Validation** (30 mins): Identify and validate top-quality business directories for each service type, test Puppeteer navigation, and establish data extraction templates
2. **Event Planner Collection** (90 mins): Systematically collect 50 verified event planner listings across 10 cities using established methodology and quality checkpoints  
3. **Caterer Collection** (60 mins): Apply proven methodology to collect 30 authentic catering business listings with focus on cuisine types and service details
4. **Photographer Collection** (60 mins): Complete data collection with 30 photography business listings, emphasizing portfolio quality and specialization details

**Quality Assurance**: Implement progressive validation with cross-source verification, maintain standardized data entry templates, and document all sources for transparency. Use screenshots for authenticity verification and CSV format optimization for Google Sheets compatibility.

**Risk Mitigation**: Handle anti-scraping measures through natural browsing patterns, verify business operational status through multiple indicators, and maintain data consistency through systematic templates and review cycles.
